about.heading: About AcePool (ACEP)
about.description:
Deliver a high performance and secure node that can process transactions on the CARDANO Blockchain.

Although operating in the GMT time zone, the pool offers automated scripts that make keep pool running smoothly. To incentivise the usage of the cardano ecosystem and also staking, this pool has plans to develop decentralized applications.
about.jackpot: Jackpot System - is a way to redistribute ADA rewards, earned by this pool at the end of each EPOCH. The value for this jackpot will be calculated the difference of the received rewards by pool expenses, and the remaining value will be sent to a random address from the list of delegators.

faqs.title: More info on Cardano
faqs.description: Still learning about Cardano? Take a look into the most common FAQ's

questions.title: What is a stake pool?
questions.description: A stake pool is a network node with a public address for users to delegate to. Stake pools are run by a reliable operator: an individual or business with the knowledge and resources to run the node on a consistent basis.

questions.title: What is delegation on Cardano?
questions.description: Delegation is the process by which ada holders delegate the stake associated with their ada to a stake pool. It allows ada holders that do not have the skills or desire to run a node to participate in the network and be rewarded in proportion to the amount of stake delegated

questions.title: Why delegate to ACE Pool (ACEP)?
questions.description: By delegating into Ace Pool not only you are taking a high percentage Return on Staking, you are also helping the Cardano ecosystem to achieve is main purpose, Decentralisation! Smaller Pools usually have higher ROS, although we might shoot for the stars, ACE POOL always try to put in place incentives to leverage the amount on stake in our Pool(s) so delegators can get optimal ROS!
